The Calculate Composite Index tool combines multiple numeric variables to create a single index.

The table or features containing the variables that will be combined into the index.

The count of features depends on additional factors such as filtering criteria and the analysis extent.

Layer is specified by default when Input features or table is not populated. To add an input table, select Table before adding a dataset.

The fields containing the variables that will be combined to create the index. Reverse direction specifies whether the values of the variables will be reversed. Weight is the relative influence of each variable on the index.

Specifies the method that will be used to scale the input variables and combine the scaled variables to create the index.

Specifies whether the output index values will be reversed in direction. When checked, high values will be treated as low index values and vice versa.

The minimum and maximum of the output index values.

The name of the layer that will be created and added to the map.

The name of the folder in My content where the result will be saved.
